column4: I really need the alternate version for my 128 MB RAM notebook, now I have to mess with alternative methods...
ouch.. 128MB.. how old is that thing?
I'm wondering if it might not be easier to start with the minimal install cd..
perhaps point that to the lubuntu repositories after the install (lubuntu has its own repositories, right?)
ah.. you can't use the lubuntu regular install cd as repository ?
that's exactly what I'm doing now
ah.. sorry.. I don't think I've been reading the entire conversation
I'm going to give this a try in a vm.. see if I can get it to work
if you have any clue, please call me... I'll stay here in the chat
sure.. one more question.. you've got some kind of wired connection to the net on this laptop? or it's wireless only?
I have no cable for the PCMCIA card, only a USB ethernet stick with RT2500 (Linux compatible) chipset
and it seems I can only setup wireless with the network manager... I only have to fill in ESSID and WEP and it works directly out of the box
ok, I'll try without any network connection.. using the lubuntu install cd as repository
here it says: "W: Skipping nonexisten file /media/apt/dists/lucid/main/binary-i386/Packages" and the same message for "/media/apt/dists/lucid/restricted/binary-i386/Packages
hmm.. lets see if I get the same
did you get the same error?
ok, tried with the 10.04 alternate install as a base, then I tried adding the lubuntu cd as a repository but it didn't like that at all.. same error messages that you got
ok tnx for trying
crap, it even doesn't recognize the Xubuntu cd
did you install with (x)ubuntu alternate or with mini.iso?
I installed the ubuntu alternate version first.. command line only
the minimal iso required an internet connection.. I figured I would try without that first
